com.camerontec.catalys.util.data

Interface IValue

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ITagValue
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardTagValue, StandardValue

    public interface IValue
extends Cloneable, Serializable
    Wrapper for values of different type.

    Also supplies conversion between values where possible.

    • Method Detail

      • accessInternalBytesSegment

        BytesSegment accessInternalBytesSegment()
        Provides access to the value's internal byte array.

        Access is provided through the value's internal BytesSegment modified to point to the internal byte array.

        If no BytesSegment exists, an empty one is created.

        This is a low level method which should not normally be used. It can be useful when an IValue object is being reused and you want to reuse the internal byte array from a previous value.

        Note that this call will destroy the existing value if that value is a reference to external bytes because the underlying BytesSegment is changed to point to the value's own internal byte array.

        Typical use of this method would be: 

           BytesSegment bs = v.accessInternalBytesSegment();
   //Suppose we want to copy in n bytes
   bs.grow(n, false);
 
   ...Copy n bytes into bs.bytes starting from index 0.
 
   bs.start = 0;
   bs.length = n;
   //Now use one of the standard set methods which takes a BytesSegment
   //to complete setting the value. For example...
   v.setValueAsAsciiBytes( bs, false );
   //Note that the set method was called with copy false.
   //This is because the bytes have already been copied where they
   //need to be.
        Returns:
        The underlying BytesSegment. Never returns null, but the returned BytesSegment may be empty - that is the bytes attribute of the BytesSegment may be null.

      • clone

        Object clone()
        Values must be cloneable.
        Returns:
        a clone of this value

      • convert

        void convert(int type,
             IValue other)
      throws ConversionException
        Copies value from another IValue object into this one, converting the value to the given type.

        Note that if type == other.getNativeType, this is equivalent to copyFrom(IValue).

        Parameters:
        type - Type to be converted to - see IValue.TYPE_xxx constants.
        other - IValue whose value is to be converted.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - if value cannot be converted.

      • copyFrom

        void copyFrom(IValue other)
        Copies values from another IValue object into this one.

        Note that no object creation occurs here unless bytes are being copied and this object's byte array is not long enough.

        Parameters:
        other - IValue whose value is to be copied.

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object other)
        True if two values are equal without any type conversion.

        For example a String value "2" would not be considered as equal to an int value of 2, because getNativeType() returns different types.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - The value to compare with this value.
        Returns:
        True if the other value equals this value.

      • equalsWithConversion

        boolean equalsWithConversion(IValue other)
        True if two values are equal after a possible type conversion.

        For example a String value "2" would be considered as equal to an int value of 2.

        Parameters:
        other - The value to compare with this value.
        Returns:
        True if the other value equals this value.

      • getNativeType

        int getNativeType()
        Returns the type that this value was defined with.

        Type constants are declared in IValue.TYPE_xxx.

        For example if the value was set as as int, int is its native type even though you could retrieve a String representation of that int.

        Returns:
        int specifying the native type of this value or -1 indicating undefined.

      • getValueAsAsciiBytes

        BytesSegment getValueAsAsciiBytes()
                           throws ConversionException
        Returns the bytes making up the ASCII string.

        May return null if no value is defined.

        Code using this method should not assume that the BytesSegment returned is a pristine one, that is, if you need to access the underlying byte array you should not reference the BytesSegment.bytes variable directly but use the BytesSegment.copyBytes() method instead.

        Returns:
        String bytes - may be null.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If value cannot be converted.

      • getValueAsBytes

        BytesSegment getValueAsBytes()
                      throws ConversionException
        Bytes of byte vector in the form of a BytesSegment.

        May return null if no value is defined.

        Code using this method should not assume that the BytesSegment returned is a pristine one, that is, if you need to access the underlying byte array you should not reference the BytesSegment.bytes variable directly but use the BytesSegment.copyBytes() method instead.

        Returns:
        Bytes of byte vector - may be null.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If value cannot be converted.

      • getValueAsDecimal

        Decimal getValueAsDecimal()
                   throws ConversionException
        Decimal value returned as Decimal object.

        Attempts to convert value from its native type if necessary.

        May return null if no value is defined.

        Returns:
        Decimal value - may be null.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If value cannot be converted.

      • getValueAsInt

        int getValueAsInt()
           throws ConversionException
        Int value.

        Attempts to convert value from its native type if necessary.

        Returns:
        int value
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If value cannot be converted.

      • getValueAsString

                 throws ConversionException
        String value.

        Attempts to convert value from its native type if necessary.

        May return null if no value is defined.

        Returns:
        String - may be null.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If value cannot be converted.

        BytesSegment getValueAsUnicodeBytes()
                             throws ConversionException
        Unicode String bytes.

        Returns:
        Unicode bytes - may be null.
        Throws:
        ConversionException - If value cannot be converted.

      • isNone

        boolean isNone()
        The value is empty.

        Note that this is different from undefined. We have a defined value - which is empty. Undefined means that we do not know the value at all.

        Returns:
        True if the value is empty.

      • isUndefined

        boolean isUndefined()
        The value is undefined, i.e TYPE_Unknown. Note that the type could be defined (as returned by getNativeType), but the value is undefined.

        Undefined means that a value is not currently used. This allows implementations of ITagValues to pool discarded objects for reuse when they are no longer needed, rather than deleting and creating new values/tag values.

        Returns:
        True if the value is undefined.

      • setNone

        void setNone()
        After calling this, native type becomes undefined and isNone will return true.

      • setUndefined

        void setUndefined()
        After calling this, the native type becomes undefined TYPE_Unknown and isUndefined() will return true.

      • setValue

        void setValue(byte[] valueBytes,
              int valueStart,
              int valueLength,
              boolean copy)
        Set bytes in byte vector value.

        Bytes in vector are valueBytes[ valueStart ] .. valueBytes[ valueStart + valueLength -1 ].

        Parameters:
        valueBytes - Array containing valueBytes.
        valueStart - Bytes in vector valueStart at this index of array.
        valueLength - Number of bytes in vector.
        copy - If true a copy should be made of the bytes passed in (slower, but safer). If false a reference to the passed in byte[] will be kept instead.

      • setValue

        void setValue(byte[] valueBytes,
              int valueStart,
              int valueLength,
              boolean copy,
              String charsetName)
        Set bytes in byte vector value. The bytes are assumed to be a String encoded using the specified character set.

        Bytes in vector are valueBytes[ valueStart ] .. valueBytes[ valueStart + valueLength -1 ].

        Parameters:
        valueBytes - Array containing valueBytes.
        valueStart - Bytes in vector valueStart at this index of array.
        valueLength - Number of bytes in vector.
        copy - If true a copy should be made of the bytes passed in (slower, but safer). If false a reference to the passed in byte[] will be kept instead.
        charsetName - The character set name (encoding) for this field. Will be used in getValueAsString().

      • getCharsetName

        String getCharsetName()
        Return the character set associated with this encoded field if set via setValue(byte[], int, int, boolean, String)
        Returns:
        The character set name (encoding) for this field, or null if this is a normal (i.e. non-encoded) field.

      • setValue

        void setValue(BytesSegment value,
              boolean copy)
        Set BytesSegment value.
        Parameters:
        value - Bytes segment representing value.
        copy - If true a copy should be made of the bytes passed in (slower, but safer). If false a reference to the passed in byte[] will be kept instead.

      • setValue

        void setValue(Decimal value)
        Sets Decimal value.

        The Decimal values should be copied across rather than just storing a reference to the given Decimal object.

        Parameters:
        value - New value.
